chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x

Premises:
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
pred_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (predZ y) = predZ (addZ x y)
succ_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (succZ y) = succZ (addZ x y)
succ_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (succZ x) y = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (predZ x) y = predZ (addZ x y)
succ_predZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = x
pred_succZ : forall x : Z, predZ (succZ x) = x
addZ_eq1 : forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y
eq_OZ_dec : forall x : Z, {x = OZ} + {x <> OZ}
succ_pred_pred_succZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = predZ (succZ x)
BinInt.Z.eq_sym_iff : forall x y : BinNums.Z, x = y < -> y = x
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
BinPos.Peqb_true_eq : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.eqb x y = true -> x = y
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, Fin.FS x = Fin.FS y -> x = y where ?n : [ |- nat]
BinNat.N.lt_irrefl : forall x : BinNums.N, ~ BinNat.N.lt x x
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
addZ_eq2 : forall y : Z, addZ (pos 0) y = succZ y
addZ_eq4 : forall y : Z, addZ (neg 0) y = predZ y
Eqdep_dec.eq_rect_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (p : A) (Q : A -> Type) (x : Q p) (h : p = p), x = eq_rect p Q x p h
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
Eqdep_dec.eq_dep_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (P : A -> Type) (p : A) (x y : P p), EqdepFacts.eq_dep A P p x p y -> x = y
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
BinIntDef.Z.pred = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zneg BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pred _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope
BinNat.N.min_mono : forall f : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) f -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful BinNat.N.le BinNat.N.le) f -> forall x y : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.min (f x) (f y) = f (BinNat.N.min x y)
ssrbool.in_simpl : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (p : ssrbool.pred T) (msp : ssrbool.manifest_simpl_pred (T:=T) p), ssrbool.in_mem x (ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x0 : T => ssrbool.PredOfSimpl.coerce (ssrbool.simpl_pred_value msp) x0)) = p x
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Pnat.Pos2Nat.inj_iter : forall (p : BinNums.positive) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (x : A), BinPos.Pos.iter f x p = nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) x (fun _ : nat => f) (BinPos.Pos.to_nat p)

```coq
Theorem goal : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x.
Proof.
unfold addZ.
induction x as [|n|m]; simpl; auto.
Qed.```
